numlitem.para: Rudder trim actuator is operative, and
Rudder trim is verified centered before each departure.
Before each takeoff, confirm rudder position is centered by checking that the rudder pedals are essentially centered and by checking the rudder position indication displayed on secondary EICAS.

placard.para: Placard on rudder trim indicator: "RUD TRIM IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: To verify the rudder trim actuator is operative.

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Supply electrical and hydraulic power to aircraft.
Select STAT on the EICAS display select panel to display the flight controls position indications on secondary EICAS.
Rotate the rudder trim control, located on the aisle stand, to NOSE LEFT.
On both Captain’s and First Officer’s sides, observe that left rudder pedals move forward and that right rudder pedals move aft.
Also observe that rudder position indications (upper and lower) on secondary EICAS indicate rudder moving to left.
Rotate the rudder trim control to NOSE RIGHT.
On both Captain’s and First Officer’s sides, observe that left rudder pedals move aft and that right rudder pedals move forward.
Also observe that rudder position indications (upper and lower) on secondary EICAS indicate rudder moving to right.

Return rudder trim to neutral position by rotating the rudder trim control as required until rudder pedals are aligned together and rudder position indication on EICAS shows rudder (upper and lower) centered.
Apply opaque tape over inoperative rudder trim indicator on aisle stand.
